content.description:
Thunderbird negotiates a solid, rare undercling feature that climbs above a clear, flat landing.

Sit start matched on the undercling feature. From there, manage to get your keister off the ground, gain a right hand gaston, bump the left hand along the undercling, walk the feet to the left, gain the arete, and finish up the remaining edges and bumps to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing.
content.location:
It climbs the northwest face of Aurora and shares the finish with

Act of Position

.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, work up the vertical feature, gain a sloping dish up high, and use the bumps to mantel on top.
content.protection: At least a pad or two. The landing has a rock and tree behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Aurora.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, use the vertical feature to gain and match on a horizontal edge, then reach a left hand incut edge, bump the left hand up to another edge, gain the horizontal rail above, traverse left to the arete, and finish up the bumps and edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads, preferably three. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock behind the problem's path.
content.location:
It shares the start with

Osteosperma

and the end of

Act of Position

.

content.description: Sit start at the arete. From there, follow the arete to an obvious rail, then gain the dirty bumps/edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but the end has a rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north arete of Aurora.
